summary_gpt: Apollo Tyres announced a change in its senior management structure, with Mr. C. Krishna Kumar moving to report to the Chief Manufacturing Officer and no longer being part of the senior management team, effective May 1, 2025. The change aligns the Projects team with Global Manufacturing to streamline operations.

Apollo Tyres Ltd. has disclosed that it did not undertake any borrowing through debt securities for FY 2024-25, with no shortfalls or penalties reported. The company remains compliant with its borrowing obligations for the specified period.

Apollo Tyres disclosed its outstanding borrowings as of March 31, 2025, amounting to Rs. 2,452.72 crore, with a strong credit rating profile from CRISIL and India Ratings. The filing is a regulatory disclosure required for large corporates regarding their borrowings and credit ratings.

Apollo Tyres Ltd. has acquired an additional 3.43% stake in Green Infra Wind Power Projects Limited, increasing its total holding to 21.27%, to procure wind power. The acquisition involves 60,000 shares at Rs.10 each, expected to be completed by early May 2025.

Apollo Tyres has submitted a restated trust deed for its Employee Stock Option Scheme 2025, aligning with SEBI regulations. This indicates ongoing employee benefit initiatives and corporate compliance.

Apollo Tyres plans to discontinue tyre production at its Netherlands subsidiary's Enschede plant by summer 2026 due to high production costs, subject to local consultation and approval. The closure will impact approximately 5.8% of the company's revenue and 8.4% of its net worth as of March 2024.
